website_summaries.verdict: A smaller racquet for those with big aspirations.
pros: This starter racquet has a compact, “beginner frame” layout for those just beginning their racquetball journey
It’s great for kids too, and features alloy construction that’s sturdy enough to handle smacking floors and walls
cons: In terms of string tension, this model is not as powerful as some others

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the Small Sweet Spot
customer_reviews.text: I did not feel like this racquet gave me much power. It's light and durable, but I tried a HEAD brand racquet at the same price point and felt that it was much more powerful/had a much larger sweet spot than this Python. I recommend going with the racquets that HEAD sells for about the same price.
customer_reviews.author: thescout

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as a "beginner frame", but it is the same size as an adult frame.
customer_reviews.text: Product is fine for my 9 year old grandson. I was disappointed that the frame was not a bit smaller. It is the same size as mine, so the "beginner frame" was a bit of false advertising. I could have purchased a basic adult racquet at Walmart for around $15.00 which would have been a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Tim L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Better Than Some Hige End Brands
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a beginner, my 12yo is starting to play and it seems well made, very durable.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna R

customer_reviews.title: Nice racquet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a great racquetball racquet for a beginner. Wife and I wanted to try it and this racquet was a great price to try something new that won’t empty your wallet.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my daughter to play at the community center since their racquets are inconsistent. For the value and durability, I don’t think I could have found a better deal. My teen drags this racquet everywhere and it holds up beautifully. The handle is also soft and appropriate- not too sticky. We use the looped cord to hand the racquet when it’s not in use.
customer_reviews.author: LooLoo

customer_reviews.title: Broke at 32 days after purchase. I only go ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke at 32 days after purchase. I only go to the gym 3x a week for about half an hour so expect to get only 6 hours of use from this item. I would be more understanding if I had accidentally hit the wall or floor or even if we used the harder black balls, but we had standard blue. The act of hitting the ball sent the plastic pieces to shatter off and fly all over the room.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Katsuleas

customer_reviews.title: Ok for young kids
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, smaller than standard racket, perhaps ok for kids. My 10 year old who is beginner likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Sameer

customer_reviews.title: Sports
customer_reviews.text: Fits my hand perfect! I’m new to this game I may have more to say once I have mastered the game!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Ness

customer_reviews.title: Great racquet for beginner or someone who hasn't played in a while
customer_reviews.text: I haven't played since the early 80's so getting back into the swing of things (no pun intended), this was perfect. Highly recommend for that person who isn't trying to be ultra competitive but is looking for a great work out. Strong and Durable.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G.

customer_reviews.title: Good racquet for the money spent.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the string to have a better knot in it for adjustability, but aside from that, this racquet gets the job done well.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Duran

customer_reviews.title: How it fits and feels in you hand.
customer_reviews.text: A great racquetball racquet for a beginner. Highly recommend for the new player to the game.
customer_reviews.author: KrissiB

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Affordable and durable. Will buy more for my gym.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Blondell

customer_reviews.title: Nice but needs new strings out of box
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice racket, but it is strung to soft and caused me to injure both wrists when playing trying to get speed on the ball.
customer_reviews.author: ben altekruse

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and good for newbies to the game
customer_reviews.text: Just getting into the sport and like this racket very much. Lite weight and a comfortable grip.
customer_reviews.author: ANN OUELLETTE

customer_reviews.title: Nice racket
customer_reviews.text: Racket is nice, great sweet spot. Wish it would have come with a cover
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Improved reaction time
customer_reviews.text: Great raquette, nice and light. I would give it 5 stars but I have only used it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Bromlen Steinburg

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: the bumper guard broke at the top when the ball hit the edge. the metal isnt that good
customer_reviews.author: vikram

customer_reviews.title: Very good value...
customer_reviews.text: Thus far, this racquet appears to be a very good value. It works well, has tight strings, handles nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value excellent construction better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: A lot better than expected really enjoyed playing with the racket today would recommend for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Rosbrugh

product_meta.title: Python Intro 5000 Racquetball Racquet Series (Beginner Frame, Amazing Value, Real Racquetball Brand)
product_meta.description: Good value, durability and a brand. Designed by Python Racquetball.
feature_bullets: Perfect Racquet for any beginner trying out the sport.
